verses.verse: Then Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>,
If we assay<WH5254> to commune<WH1697> with thee, wilt thou be grieved<WH3811>? but who can<WH3201> withhold<WH6113> himself from speaking<WH4405>? to: Heb. a word withhold: Heb. refrain from words?
Behold, thou hast instructed<WH3256> many<WH7227>, and thou hast strengthened<WH2388> the weak<WH7504> hands<WH3027>.
Thy words<WH4405> have upholden<WH6965> him that was falling<WH3782>, and thou hast strengthened<WH553> the feeble<WH3766> knees<WH1290>.
But now it is come<WH935> upon thee, and thou faintest<WH3811>; it toucheth<WH5060> thee, and thou art troubled<WH926>.
Is not this thy fear<WH3374>, thy confidence<WH3690>, thy hope<WH8615>, and the uprightness<WH8537> of thy ways<WH1870>?
Remember<WH2142>, I pray thee, who ever perished<WH6>, being innocent<WH5355>? or where<WH375> were the righteous<WH3477> cut off<WH3582>?
Even as I have seen<WH7200>, they that plow<WH2790> iniquity<WH205>, and sow<WH2232> wickedness<WH5999>, reap<WH7114> the same.
By the blast<WH5397> of God<WH433> they perish<WH6>, and by the breath<WH7307> of his nostrils<WH639> are they consumed<WH3615>. by the breath: that is, by his anger
The roaring<WH7581> of the lion<WH738>, and the voice<WH6963> of the fierce lion<WH7826>, and the teeth<WH8127> of the young lions<WH3715>, are broken<WH5421>.
The old lion<WH3918> perisheth<WH6> for lack<WH1097> of prey<WH2964>, and the stout lion's<WH3833> whelps<WH1121> are scattered abroad<WH6504>.
Now a thing<WH1697> was secretly brought<WH1589> to me, and mine ear<WH241> received<WH3947> a little<WH8102> thereof. secretly: Heb. by stealth
In thoughts<WH5587> from the visions<WH2384> of the night<WH3915>, when deep sleep<WH8639> falleth<WH5307> on men<WH582>,
Fear<WH6343> came<WH7122> upon me, and trembling<WH7461>, which made all<WH7230> my bones<WH6106> to shake<WH6342>. came: Heb. met all: Heb. the multitude of
Then a spirit<WH7307> passed<WH2498> before my face<WH6440>; the hair<WH8185> of my flesh<WH1320> stood up<WH5568>:

It stood still<WH5975>, but I could not discern<WH5234> the form<WH4758> thereof: an image<WH8544> was before mine eyes<WH5869>, there was silence<WH1827>, and I heard<WH8085> a voice<WH6963>, saying, there: or, I heard a still voice
Shall mortal man<WH582> be more just<WH6663> than God<WH433>? shall a man<WH1397> be more pure<WH2891> than his maker<WH6213>?
Behold, he put no trust<WH539> in his servants<WH5650>; and his angels<WH4397> he charged<WH7760> with folly<WH8417>: and his: or, nor in his angels, in whom he put light
How much less<WH637> in them that dwell<WH7931> in houses<WH1004> of clay<WH2563>, whose foundation<WH3247> is in the dust<WH6083>, which are crushed<WH1792> before<WH6440> the moth<WH6211>?
They are destroyed<WH3807> from morning<WH1242> to evening<WH6153>: they perish<WH6> for ever<WH5331> without any regarding<WH7760> it. destroyed: Heb. beaten in pieces
Doth not their excellency<WH3499> which is in them go away<WH5265>? they die<WH4191>, even without wisdom<WH2451>.
